name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Thomas Corbett, Attorney General v. Boris Michael SURGENT a/k/a Michael Surgent, Individually and d/b/a Wellcraft Custom and d/b/a Allied Corp. and a/k/a Wellcraft Corporation d/b/a General Custom Construction and Slow Credit Mortgage Co. and Keystone State Mortgage Corp. and U.S. Land and Abstract Appeal of Sharon A. Gimbi

parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Thomas Corbett, Attorney General v. Boris Michael SURGENT a/k/a Michael Surgent, Individually and d/b/a Wellcraft Custom and d/b/a Allied Corp. and a/k/a Wellcraft Corporation d/b/a General Custom Construction and Slow Credit Mortgage Co. and Keystone State Mortgage Corp. and U.S. Land and Abstract Appeal of Sharon A. Gimbi.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
The Order of the Commonwealth Court denying the “Motion for Recidivism” is VACATED and the court is instructed to transfer the matter to the Court of Common Pleas of Carbon County for proceedings on Petitioner’s Motion. See, 42 Pa.C.S. § 5103(a); Pa.R.C.P. 1032(b).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
922 A.2d 883
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Thomas Corbett, Attorney General v. Boris Michael SURGENT a/k/a Michael Surgent, Individually and d/b/a Wellcraft Custom and d/b/a Allied Corp. and a/k/a Wellcraft Corporation d/b/a General Custom Construction and Slow Credit Mortgage Co. and Keystone State Mortgage Corp. and U.S. Land and Abstract Appeal of Sharon A. Gimbi.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
May 31, 2007.
